passage_text: The average Wells Fargo salary ranges from approximately $15,000 per year for Data Entry Clerk to $320,000 per year for Business Development Officer.

My estimate is that Wells Fargo has roughly around 300,000 employees. My proposal is take $3 billion dollars, just a small fraction of what Wells Fargo pulls in annually, and raise every employees annual salary by $10,000 dollars. This equates to an hourly raise about $4.71 per hour.

Employers who willfully or repeatedly violate the minimum wage or overtime pay requirements are subject to a civil money penalty of up to $1,100 for each employee for each pay period in which a violation occurred. Wells Fargo is no stranger to claims of wage and hour non-compliance FLSA. In 2006,Wells Fargo agreed to pay $12.8 million to settle a lawsuit brought by its business systems consultants who alleged violations of the FLSA’s overtime rules.

You start at $10 an hour with possible fifty cent increases every 3 months for completing training (paid training). You top out at $11.50 but you can receive increases on top … of that from your end of the year review with good performance in sales and service.  Ummm...

CEO John Stumpf makes 473 times more than the salary of a median employee, according to Bloomberg. That ratio of CEO-to-employee pay puts Wells Fargo at No. 33 among S&P 500 companies and third highest among financial institutions on the list. He earned $19.3 million in total compensation last year.
In my area of New Jersey a teller at Wells Fargo Bank makes $13.00 an hour. That is roughly $13,520.00 a year for a part time teller doing 20 hours a week.
